member.name: T:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.OutputMode
member.summary: Output mode setting

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.OutputMode.SingleLine
member.summary: Output the minified code on a single line for maximum minification. LineBreakThreshold may still break the single line into multiple lines at a syntactically correct point after the given line length is reached. Not easily human-readable.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.OutputMode.MultipleLines
member.summary: Output the minified code on multiple lines to increase readability

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.OutputMode.None
member.summary: Supress code output; typically used for linting or analysis of source code

member.name: T:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.BlockStart
member.summary: Describes how to output the opening curly-brace for blocks when the OutputMode is set to MultipleLines.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.BlockStart.NewLine
F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.BlockStart.SameLine
F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.BlockStart.UseSource
member.summary: Output the opening curly-brace block-start character on the same line or a new line depending on how it was specified in the sources.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CommonSettings
member.summary: Common settings shared between CSS and JS settings objects

member.name: P:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CommonSettings.AllowEmbeddedAspNetBlocks
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean value indicating whether embedded asp.net blocks (<% %>) should be recognized and output as is. Default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CommonSettings.BlocksStartOnSameLine
member.summary: Returns or sets whether the opening curly brace for blocks is on its own line (NewLine, default) or on the same line as the preceding code (SameLine) or taking a hint from the source code position (UseSource). Only relevant when OutputMode is set to MultipleLines.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CommonSettings.IgnoreAllErrors
member.summary: Returns or sets a flag for whether to ignore ALL errors found in the input code. Default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CommonSettings.IndentSize
member.summary: Returns or sets an integer value specifying the number of spaces per indent level when in MultipleLines output mode. (Default = 4)

member.name: P:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CommonSettings.LineBreakThreshold
member.summary: Returns or sets the column position at which the line will be broken at the next available opportunity. Default value is int.MaxValue - 1000.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CommonSettings.OutputMode
P:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CommonSettings.TermSemicolons
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean value indicting whether to add a semicolon at the end of the parsed code (true) or not (false, default)

member.name: P:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CommonSettings.KillSwitch
member.summary: Returns or sets a long integer value containing kill switch flags for each individual mod to the parsed code tree. Allows for callers to turn off specific modifications if desired. Default is 0, meaning no kill switches are set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CommonSettings.LineTerminator
member.summary: Returns an appropriate line-terminator string given the output mode

member.name: T:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CssParser
member.summary: Parser takes Tokens and parses them into rules and statements

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CssParser.s_regexHack1
member.summary: regular expression for matching first comment hack This is the MacIE ignore bug: /*(anything or nothing inside)\*/.../*(anything or nothing inside)*/

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CssParser.s_regexHack2
member.summary: Regular expression for matching second comment hack Hide from everything EXCEPT Netscape 4 and Opera 5 Format: /*/*//*/.../*(anything or nothing inside)*/

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CssParser.s_regexHack3
member.summary: Regular expression for matching third comment hack Hide from Netscape 4 Format: /*/*/.../*(anything or nothing inside)*/

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CssParser.s_regexHack4
member.summary: Regular expression for matching fourth comment hack Hide from IE6 Format: property /*(anything or nothing inside)*/:value WARNING: This does not actually parse the property/value -- it simply looks for a word character followed by at least one whitespace character, followed by a simple comment, followed by optional space, followed by a colon. Does not match the simple word, the space or the colon (just the comment)

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CssParser.s_regexHack5
member.summary: Regular expression for matching fifth comment hack Hide from IE5.5 Format: property:/* (anything or nothing inside) */value WARNING: This does not actually parse the property/value -- it simply looks for a word character followed by optional whitespace character, followed by a colon, followed by optional whitespace, followed by a simple comment. Does not match initial word or the colon, just the comment.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CssParser.s_regexHack6
member.summary: Regular expression for matching sixth comment hack -- although not a real hack Hide from IE6, NOT Format: property/*(anything or nothing inside)*/:value NOTE: This doesn't actually hide from IE6; it needs a space before the comment to actually work. but enoough people code this in their CSS and expect it to be output that I recieved enough requests to add it to the allowed "hacks" WARNING: This does not actually parse the property/value -- it simply looks for a word character followed by a simple comment, followed by optional space, followed by a colon. Does not match the simple word or the colon (just initial whitespace and comment)

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CssParser.s_regexHack7
member.summary: Regular expression for empty comments These comments don't really do anything. But if the developer wrote an empty comment (/**/ or /* */), then it has no documentation value and might possibly be an attempted comment hack. Format: /**/ or /* */ (single space)

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CssParser.s_rrggbb
member.summary: matches 6-digit RGB color value where both r digits are the same, both g digits are the same, and both b digits are the same (but r, g, and b values are not necessarily the same). Used to identify #rrggbb values that can be collapsed to #rgb

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CssParser.s_valueReplacement
member.summary: regular expression for matching css comments containing special formatted identifiers for value-replacement matching Format: /* [id] */

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CssParser.s_sharepointReplacement
member.summary: regular expression for matching Sharepoint Theme css comments Format: /* [ReplaceBGImage] */ /* [id(parameters)] */ where id is one of: ReplaceColor, ReplaceFont, or RecolorImage and parameters is anything other than a close square-bracket

member.name: M:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CssParser.PushWaypoint
member.summary: Push a new string builder onto the builders stack

member.name: M:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CssParser.PopWaypoint(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Pop the top waypoint off the stack. If the Settings RemoveEmptyBlocks property is false, will keep the text, regardless of the passed-in setting.
member.param: true if push the text of the popped waypoint onto the new top waypoint; false to discard
member.returns: true if the popped builder has any text within it

member.name: M:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CssParser.UnwindStackCompletely
member.summary: Get all the text that has been accumulting in the string builders on the stack, unwinding the stack until it's empty
member.returns: string representation of all parsed text

member.name: M:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CssParser.IsExcludedVendorPrefix(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if the given property is vendor-specific and the vendor prefix is in the list of excluded prefixes.
member.param: The property name
member.returns: true if excluded; false otherwise

member.name: M:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CssParser.SkipSpace
member.summary: This method advances to the next token FIRST -- effectively skipping the current one -- and then skips any space tokens that FOLLOW it.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CssParser.SkipIfSpace
member.summary: This method only skips the space that is already the current token.
member.returns: true if space was skipped; false if the current token is not space

member.name: M:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CssParser.AddNewLine
member.summary: Always add new line to the stream

member.name: M:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CssParser.NormalizedValueReplacementComment(System.String)
member.summary: regular expression for matching newline characters

member.name: M:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CssScanner.IsValidVendorPrefix(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether a given string is a valid vendor prefix. No hyphens allowed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CssScanner.GetReplacementToken(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Given the current character is a %, see if it's followed by a syntax that creates a valid replacement token. If so, return the token text.
member.param: if true, the current char is the delimiter and needs to be advanced; false means we are already at the next character and shouldn't advance
member.returns: valid token text, or null

member.summary: returns the VALUE of a unicode number, up to six hex digits

member.name: T:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CssColor
member.summary: Enumeration for how to treat known color names

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CssColor.Strict
member.summary: Convert strict names to hex values if shorter; hex values to strict names if shorter. Leave all other color names or hex values as-specified.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CssColor.Hex
member.summary: Always use hex values; do not convert any hex values to color names

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CssColor.Major
member.summary: Convert known hex values to major-browser color names if shorter; and known major-browser color names to hex if shorter.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CssColor.NoSwap
member.summary: Don't swap names for hex or hex for names, whether or not one is shorter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CssSettings.FixIE8Fonts
member.summary: Returns or sets whether IE8 .EOT fonts should get a question-mark appended to the URL (if not there already) to prevent the browser from generating invalid HTTP requests to the server. Default is true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CssSettings.ExcludeVendorPrefixes
member.summary: Returns or sets a list of vendor-specific prefixes ("ms", "webkit", "moz") that will be omitted from the output. Default is no exclusions.

member.summary: Settings for how local variables and functions can be renamed

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.LocalRenaming.KeepAll
member.summary: Keep all names; don't rename anything

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.LocalRenaming.KeepLocalizationVars
member.summary: Rename all local variables and functions that do not begin with "L_"

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.LocalRenaming.CrunchAll
member.summary: Rename all local variables and functions. (default)

member.name: T:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.EvalTreatment
member.summary: Settings for how to treat eval statements

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.EvalTreatment.Ignore
member.summary: Ignore all eval statements (default). This assumes that code that is eval'd will not attempt to access any local variables or functions, as those variables and function may be renamed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.EvalTreatment.MakeImmediateSafe
member.summary: Assume any code that is eval'd will attempt to access local variables and functions declared in the same scope as the eval statement. This will turn off local variable and function renaming in any scope that contains an eval statement.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.EvalTreatment.MakeAllSafe
member.summary: Assume that any local variable or function in any accessible scope chain may be referenced by code that is eval'd. This will turn off local variable and function renaming for all scopes that contain an eval statement, and all their parent scopes up the chain to the global scope.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CodeSettings.AlwaysEscapeNonAscii
member.summary: Returns or sets a flag indicating whether to always escape non-ASCII characters as \uXXXX or to let the output encoding object handle that via the JsEncoderFallback object for the specified output encoding format. Default is false (let the Encoding object handle it).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CodeSettings.AmdSupport
member.summary: Returns or sets whether to perform extra tasks on AMD-style defines.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CodeSettings.CollapseToLiteral
member.summary: collapse new Array() to [] and new Object() to {} [true] or leave ais [false]. Default is true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CodeSettings.ConstStatementsMozilla
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean value indicating whether to use old-style const statements (just var-statements that define unchangeable fields) or new EcmaScript 6 lexical declarations.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CodeSettings.ErrorIfNotInlineSafe
member.summary: Throw an error if a source string is not safe for inclusion in an HTML inline script block. Default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CodeSettings.EvalLiteralExpressions
member.summary: Evaluate expressions containing only literal bool, string, numeric, or null values [true] Leave literal expressions alone and do not evaluate them [false]. Default is true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CodeSettings.EvalTreatment
member.summary: Returns or sets a settings value indicating how "safe" eval-statements are to be assumed. Ignore (default) means we can assume eval-statements will not reference any local variables and functions. MakeImmediateSafe assumes eval-statements will reference local variables and function within the same scope. MakeAllSafe assumes eval-statements will reference any accessible local variable or function. Local variables that we assume may be referenced by eval-statements cannot be automatically renamed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CodeSettings.Format
member.summary: Returns or sets the format to use for the JavaScript processing.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CodeSettings.IgnoreConditionalCompilation
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean value indicating whether or not to ignore conditional-compilation comment syntax (true) or to try to retain the comments in the output (false; default)

member.name: P:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CodeSettings.IgnorePreprocessorDefines
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean value indicating whether or not to ignore preprocessor defines comment syntax (true) or to evaluate them (false; default)

member.name: P:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CodeSettings.InlineSafeStrings
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean value indicating whether to break up string literals containing </script> so inline code won't break [true, default] or to leave string literals as-is [false]

member.name: P:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CodeSettings.LocalRenaming
P:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CodeSettings.MacSafariQuirks
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean value indicating whether to add characters to the output to make sure Mac Safari bugs are not generated [true, default], or to disregard potential known Mac Safari bugs in older versions [false]

member.name: P:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CodeSettings.MinifyCode
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean value indicating whether any operations are to be applied to the parsed tree [true, default], or whether to return it as-is [false].

member.name: P:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CodeSettings.ManualRenamesProperties
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean value indicating whether object property names with the specified "from" names will get renamed to the corresponding "to" names (true, default) when using the manual-rename feature, or left alone (false)

member.name: P:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CodeSettings.PreprocessOnly
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean value indicating whether or not the input files should be preprocessed only (default is false)

member.name: P:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CodeSettings.PreserveFunctionNames
member.summary: Returns or sets whether all function names must be preserved and remain as-named (true), or can be automatically renamed (false, default).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CodeSettings.PreserveImportantComments
member.summary: Returns or sets whether to preserve important comments in the output. Default is true, preserving important comments. Important comments have an exclamation mark as the very first in-comment character (//! or /*!).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CodeSettings.QuoteObjectLiteralProperties
member.summary: Returns or sets whether to always quote object literal property names. Default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CodeSettings.ReorderScopeDeclarations
member.summary: Returns or sets whether or not to reorder function and variable declarations within scopes (true, default), or to leave the order as specified in the original source.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CodeSettings.RemoveFunctionExpressionNames
member.summary: Returns or sets whether or not to remove unreferenced function expression names (true, default) or to leave the names of function expressions, even if they are unreferenced (false).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CodeSettings.RemoveUnneededCode
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean value indicating whether to remove unneeded code, such as uncalled local functions or unreachable code [true, default], or to keep such code in the output [false].

member.name: P:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CodeSettings.ScriptVersion
member.summary: Returns or sets an enumeration that gives the parser a hint as to which version of EcmaScript standards to parse the source as. See after parsing for which version the parser thought it had based on features found in the script. Errors/warnings, and optimized output may change based on this settings value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CodeSettings.SourceMode
member.summary: Returns or sets the source mode

member.name: P:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CodeSettings.StrictMode
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean value indicating whether or not to force the input code into strict mode (true) or rely on the sources to turn on strict mode via the "use strict" prologue directive (false, default).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CodeSettings.StripDebugStatements
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean value indicating whether to strip debug statements [true, default], or leave debug statements in the output [false]

member.name: P:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CodeSettings.SymbolsMap
member.summary: Returns or sets the instance. Default is null, which won't output a symbol map.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CodeSettings.IsModificationAllowed(Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.TreeModifications)
member.summary: Determine whether a particular AST tree modification is allowed, or has been squelched (regardless of any other settings)
member.param: one or more tree modification settings
member.returns: true only if NONE of the passed modifications have their kill bits set

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.TreeModifications.None
member.summary: Default. No specific tree modification

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.TreeModifications.PreserveImportantComments
member.summary: Preserve "important" comments in output: /*! ... */

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.TreeModifications.BracketMemberToDotMember
member.summary: Replace a member-bracket call with a member-dot construct if the member name is a string literal that can be an identifier. A["B"] ==> A.B

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.TreeModifications.NewObjectToObjectLiteral
member.summary: Replace a new Object constructor call with an object literal new Object() ==> {}

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.TreeModifications.NewArrayToArrayLiteral
member.summary: Change Array constructor calls with array literals. Does not replace constructors called with a single numeric parameter (could be a capacity contructor call). new Array() ==> [] new Array(A,B,C) ==> [A,B,C]

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.TreeModifications.RemoveEmptyDefaultCase
F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.TreeModifications.RemoveEmptyCaseWhenNoDefault
F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.TreeModifications.RemoveBreakFromLastCaseBlock
member.summary: Remove the break statement from the last case block of a switch statement. switch(A){case B: C;break;} ==> switch(A){case B:C;}

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.TreeModifications.RemoveEmptyFinally
member.summary: Remove an empty finally statement if there is a non-empty catch block. try{...}catch(E){...}finally{} ==> try{...}catch(E){...}

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.TreeModifications.RemoveDuplicateVar
member.summary: Remove duplicate var declarations in a var statement that have no initializers. var A,A=B ==> var A=B var A=B,A ==> var A=B

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.TreeModifications.CombineVarStatements
member.summary: Combine adjacent var statements. var A;var B ==> var A,B

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.TreeModifications.MoveVarIntoFor
F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.TreeModifications.VarInitializeReturnToReturnInitializer
member.summary: Combine adjacent var statement and return statement to a single return statement var A=B;return A ==> return B

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.TreeModifications.IfEmptyToExpression
F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.TreeModifications.IfConditionCallToConditionAndCall
F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.TreeModifications.IfElseReturnToReturnConditional
member.summary: Replace an if-else-statement where both branches are only a single return statement with a single return statement and a conditional operator. if(A)return B;else return C ==> return A?B:C

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.TreeModifications.IfConditionReturnToCondition
member.summary: If a function ends in an if-statement that only has a true-branch containing a single return statement with no operand, replace the if-statement with just the condition expression. function A(...){...;if(B)return} ==> function A(...){...;B}

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.TreeModifications.IfConditionFalseToIfNotConditionTrue
member.summary: If the true-block of an if-statment is empty and the else-block is not, negate the condition and move the else-block to the true-block. if(A);else B ==> if(!A)B

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.TreeModifications.CombineAdjacentStringLiterals
member.summary: Combine adjacent string literals. "A"+"B" ==> "AB"

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.TreeModifications.RemoveUnaryPlusOnNumericLiteral
member.summary: Remove unary-plus operators when the operand is a numeric literal +123 ==> 123

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.TreeModifications.ApplyUnaryMinusToNumericLiteral
member.summary: Apply (and cascade) unary-minus operators to the value of a numeric literal -(4) ==> -4 (unary minus applied to a numeric 4 ==> numeric -4) -(-4) ==> 4 (same as above, but cascading)

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.TreeModifications.MinifyStringLiterals

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.TreeModifications.MinifyNumericLiterals

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.TreeModifications.SimplifyStringToNumericConversion

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.TreeModifications.BooleanLiteralsToNotOperators

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.TreeModifications.InvertIfReturn

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.TreeModifications.CombineNestedIfs

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.TreeModifications.CombineEquivalentIfReturns
member.summary: Whether it's okay to combine equivalent if-statments that return the same expression. if(cond1)return expr;if(cond2)return expr; => if(cond1||cond2)return expr;

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.TreeModifications.ChangeWhileToFor
member.summary: Whether to convert certain while-statements to for-statements. while(1)... => for(;;)... var ...;while(1)... => for(var ...;;) var ...;while(cond)... => for(var ...;cond;)...

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.TreeModifications.InvertIfContinue

member.name: M:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.Context.GetSeverity(Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.JSError)
member.summary: Return the default severity for a given JSError value guide: 0 == there will be a run-time error if this code executes 1 == the programmer probably did not intend to do this 2 == this can lead to cross-browser or future problems. 3 == this can lead to performance problems 4 == this is just not right
member.param: error code
member.returns: severity

member.name: M:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CrunchEnumerator.GenerateNameFromNumber(System.Int32)
member.summary: get the algorithmically-generated minified variable name based on the given number zero is the first name, 1 is the next, etc. This method needs to be tuned to get better gzip results.
member.param: integer position of the name to retrieve
member.returns: minified variable name

member.name: T:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.ReferenceComparer
member.summary: this class is used to sort the crunchable local fields in a scope so that the fields most in need of crunching get crunched first, therefore having the smallest-length crunched variable name. Highest priority are the fields most-often referenced. Among fields with the same reference count, the longest fields get priority. Lastly, alphabetize.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.ReferenceComparer.Compare(Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.JSVariableField,Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.JSVariableField)
member.summary: sorting method for fields that will be renamed in the minification process. The order of the fields determines which minified name it will receive -- the earlier in the list, typically the smaller, more-common the minified name. Tune this method to get better gzip results.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.CustomNode

member.name: M:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.EvaluateLiteralVisitor.ReplaceMemberBracketWithDot(Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.BinaryOperator,Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.ConstantWrapper)
member.summary: If the new literal is a string literal, then we need to check to see if our parent is a CallNode. If it is, and if the string literal can be an identifier, we'll replace it with a Member-Dot operation.

newLiteral we intend to replace this binary op node with
member.returns: true if we replaced the parent call node with a member-dot operation

member.name: M:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.EvaluateLiteralVisitor.ReplaceNodeWithLiteral(Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.AstNode,Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.ConstantWrapper)
member.summary: replace the node with a literal. If the node was wrapped in a grouping operator before (parentheses around it), then we can get rid of the parentheses too, since we are replacing the node with a single literal entity.
member.param: node to replace
literal to replace the node with

member.name: M:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.EvaluateLiteralVisitor.EvalThisOperator(Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.BinaryOperator,Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.ConstantWrapper,Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.ConstantWrapper)
member.summary: Both the operands of this operator are constants. See if we can evaluate them
member.param: the operator node
left-side operand
right-side operand

member.name: M:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.EvaluateLiteralVisitor.RotateFromLeft(Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.BinaryOperator,Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.BinaryOperator,Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.ConstantWrapper)
member.summary: We have determined that our left-hand operand is another binary operator, and its right-hand operand is a constant that can be combined with our right-hand operand. Now we want to set the right-hand operand of that other operator to the newly- combined constant value, and then rotate it up -- replace our binary operator with this newly-modified binary operator, and then attempt to re-evaluate it.
member.param: the operator node
the binary operator that is our left-hand operand
the newly-combined literal

member.name: M:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.EvaluateLiteralVisitor.RotateFromRight(Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.BinaryOperator,Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.BinaryOperator,Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.ConstantWrapper)
member.summary: We have determined that our right-hand operand is another binary operator, and its left-hand operand is a constant that can be combined with our left-hand operand. Now we want to set the left-hand operand of that other operator to the newly- combined constant value, and then rotate it up -- replace our binary operator with this newly-modified binary operator, and then attempt to re-evaluate it.
member.param: the operator node
the binary operator that is our right-hand operand
the newly-combined literal

For all other operators, include the normal assign (=), just return the same operator token. This only works if the two groups of tokens are actually defined in those orders!!!

member.name: T:Microsoft.Ajax.Utilities.JSScanner.PPOperators

summary.para: Wisej.Base is the namespace for base classes used in Wisej.Web.

member.name: T:Wisej.Base.PostbackPropertyAttribute
member.summary: Allows the property to return its value to postback requests.

member.summary: Initializes the attribute.

member.name: M:Wisej.Base.PostbackPropertyAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute.
member.param: Indicates whether the property is allowed or disallowed to return its value to postback requests.

member.name: P:Wisej.Base.PostbackPropertyAttribute.Allow
member.summary: Returns or sets whether the property is allows to return its value to postback requests.

member.name: M:Wisej.Base.PostbackPropertyAttribute.IsPostbackProperty(System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor)
member.summary: Returns true if the property allows postback requests.
member.param: Property to check.
member.returns: True if the allows postback requests.

member.name: T:Wisej.Base.PropertyNames
member.summary: Some layout code in WinForms checks for property names by reference equality. We can't use strings like "Parent" but need to use PropertyNames.Parent instead.

member.name: T:Wisej.Base.TextUtils
member.summary: Provides utility methods to measure, encode, and extract mnemonics from text.

member.name: M:Wisej.Base.TextUtils.EscapeText(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Escapes special characters in the specified string.
member.param: The text to escape.
Indicates that html tags should not be escaped. The default is false.
member.returns: The escaped string. Null if the specified string was null, or empty if it was empty.

member.name: M:Wisej.Base.TextUtils.EscapeText(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Removes the ampersand from the text and encodes html characters if necessary.
member.param: The text to convert.
Whether to encode html characters.
Whether to convert the first mnemonic to an underlined character.

Whether to convert newlines (CRLF) to
. The conversion is performed only when allowHtml is false, or, if allowHtml is true and the text doesn't contain any html.
member.returns: The escaped string. Null if the specified string was null, or empty if it was empty.

member.name: M:Wisej.Base.TextUtils.GeMnemonic(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the first character that is preceded by an ampersand (&).
member.param: The string from which to extract the mnemonic character.

member.name: M:Wisej.Base.TextUtils.MeasureText(System.String,System.Drawing.Font)
member.summary: Returns the size of the specified text when rendered with the specified font.
member.param: The text to measure.
The to apply to the measured text.
member.returns: The computed of the specified text.

member.name: M:Wisej.Base.TextUtils.MeasureText(System.String,System.Drawing.Font,System.Drawing.Size)
member.summary: Returns the size of the specified text when rendered with the specified font.
member.param: The text to measure.
The to apply to the measured text.
The to use as bounding rectangle for the text.

member.name: P:Wisej.Base.TextUtils.DeviceContext
member.summary: Returns the Azure Web Site compatible device context used to measure strings.

member.name: M:Wisej.Base.TextUtils.MeasureText(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Drawing.Font,System.Action{System.Drawing.Size})
member.summary: Returns the size of the specified text when rendered with the specified font.
member.param: The text to measure.
The text to measure may contain HTML tags.
The to apply to the measured text.
Result callback method, invoked when the client has finished measuring the text.

member.name: M:Wisej.Base.TextUtils.MeasureTextAsync(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Drawing.Font,System.Int32)
member.summary: Asynchronously returns the size of the specified text when rendered with the specified font. The measurement is performed on the browser. Returns an awaitable that contains the measured size.
member.param: The text to measure.
The text to measure may contain HTML tags.
The to apply to the measured text.
The optional width to use as bounding rectangle for the text.
member.returns: An awaitable that represents the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Wisej.Base.TextUtils.MeasureText(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Drawing.Font,System.Int32,System.Action{System.Drawing.Size})
member.summary: Returns the size of the specified text when rendered with the specified font.
member.param: The text to measure.
The text to measure may contain HTML tags.
The to apply to the measured text.
The width to use as bounding rectangle for the text.
Result callback method, invoked when the client has finished measuring the text.

member.summary: Applies the specified CharacterCasing rule to the text.

The CharacterCasing rule to apply to the text.

member.summary: Escapes HTML brackets and other html entities ready for being assigned to innerHTML without calling unescape() on the client.

member.summary: The base class for the class.

member.summary: Verifies the server license.

member.summary: Called when the application loaded and before it is started.

member.summary: Called when the application is reloaded and before the event is fired.

member.name: E:Wisej.Base.ApplicationBase.ThreadBegin
member.summary: Fired when the current thread starts processing the request from the client.
member.remarks:
This event is not related to a session. Any static code can attach to this event in order to setup or clean up thread static fields or any other isolated static storage.
It is best to attach to this event from a static type initializer.

member.name: E:Wisej.Base.ApplicationBase.ThreadEnd
member.summary: Fired when the current thread has completed processing the request from the client.
member.remarks:
This event is not related to a session. Any static code can attach to this event in order to setup or clean up thread static fields or any other isolated static storage.
It is best to attach to this event from a static type initializer.

member.name: E:Wisej.Base.ApplicationBase.ApplicationStart
member.summary: Fired when the application is started, after the Main method is called.

member.name: E:Wisej.Base.ApplicationBase.ApplicationExit
member.summary: Fired when the application is about to shut down.

member.name: E:Wisej.Base.ApplicationBase.ApplicationRefresh
member.summary: Fired when the application is reloaded in the browser because the user hit refresh or changed the URL.

member.name: E:Wisej.Base.ApplicationBase.Idle
member.summary: Fired when the current thread has completed processing all the events and before the response is sent back to the client.

member.name: E:Wisej.Base.ApplicationBase.EnterThreadModal
member.summary: Fired when the current thread is about to enter the modal state and before the it's suspended.
member.remarks: A thread enters the modal state - it is suspended and waits for a second thread to release it - when the application shows a modal dialog or a modal message box.

member.name: E:Wisej.Base.ApplicationBase.LeaveThreadModal
member.summary: Fired when the current thread is released from the modal state.
member.remarks: A thread exits the modal state when a modal dialog or modal message box is closed by the user or by the code.

member.name: E:Wisej.Base.ApplicationBase.ThreadException
member.summary: Fired when a thread exception is thrown.

member.name: E:Wisej.Base.ApplicationBase.SessionTimeout
member.summary: Fired when the session is about to time out.
member.remarks:
The default behavior built-in Wisej is to display a dialog asking the user to prolong the session.
Set Handled to true to stop the default behavior.

member.name: E:Wisej.Base.ApplicationBase.BeginRequest
member.summary: Fired at the beginning of every request.

member.name: E:Wisej.Base.ApplicationBase.EndRequest
member.summary: Fired at the end of every request.

member.summary: Fired when the current theme is changed.

member.summary: Returns or sets whether the browser will ask the user to confirm unloading the current page.

remarks.para: This property attaches the window.onbeforeunload event. See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WindowEventHandlers/onbeforeunload.

It's not possible to determine whether the page is being unloaded because the user is trying to close the tab, close the browser, or is refreshing the page, or is taking any other action that may reload the page.

member.name: M:Wisej.Base.ApplicationBase.StartPolling(System.Int32)
member.summary: Instructs the client to start polling the server for UI changes at the specified when a WebSocket connection is not available.
member.param: Polling interval in milliseconds. The minimum is 1000ms.

remarks.para: Calling this method when is true has no effect.

Use client side polling when you know that your code will start a background task that needs to update the client asynchronously (push updates) and your server or clients don't support WebSocket connections.
Once the background tasks are completed call to reduce the incoming requests from the client.

member.exception: The specified is less than 1.

member.name: M:Wisej.Base.ApplicationBase.StartTask(System.Action)
member.summary: Starts a new task within the current application context and returns immediately. See also .
member.param: Start method invoked by the new task when it starts up.

remarks.para: The task runs in the background but it's still capable of updating the client asynchronously when working with WebSocket by calling the method to push the UI updates to the client browser.

If you want to support background updates for clients or servers that can't use the WebSocket connection, you can either add a component to the parent container to force period requests to the server, or you can use the and methods.

member.returns: An awaitable .

member.name: M:Wisej.Base.ApplicationBase.StartTask``1(System.Func{``0})
member.summary: Starts a new task with a return value within the current application context and returns immediately. See also .
member.param: Start method invoked by the new task when it starts up.

remarks.para: The task runs in the background but it's still capable of updating the client asynchronously when working with WebSocket by calling the method to push the UI updates to the client browser.
The generics overload of allows the task to return a value. You can use this with the async/await pattern and asynchronously wait for the task to complete.

If you want to support background updates for clients or servers that can't use the WebSocket connection, you can either add a component to the parent container to force period requests to the server, or you can use the and methods.
Note that you don't have to specify the type in the angular brackets, the compiler will automatically detect the type from the return value of the asynchronous function.

member.name: M:Wisej.Base.ApplicationBase.RunInContext(Wisej.Core.IWisejComponent,System.Action)
member.summary: Executes the callback in context.
member.param: The application context to update. It can be any Wisej component or the returned by the property .
Function to execute in context. The code in the function can access all the static Application properties when executed from an out-of-bound thread.

member.name: M:Wisej.Base.ApplicationBase.Update(Wisej.Core.IWisejComponent,System.Action)
member.summary: Executes the optional callback in context and pushes all the pending updates to the client when in WebSocket mode.
member.param: The application context to update. It can be any Wisej component or the returned by the property .
Function to execute in context. The code in the function can access all the static Application properties when executed from an out-of-bound thread.

remarks.para: Use this method when you need to update the client asynchronously from an out-of-bound thread (different thread, not originating from a client request).
You can call this method at the end of the code that updates the UI:
Or you can use the optional function to enclose the code that updates the UI in a block and ensure that the client is updated when the code block exits:

member.name: T:Wisej.Base.Component
member.summary:
The base class for Wisej components that are not controls. Wisej components are still managed on the client and the server but are not present on the designer surface.
Examples of wisej components are: menu items, image lists, tree nodes, list items.

member.name: M:Wisej.Base.ControlBase.Update(System.String)
member.summary: Forces the server to update the specified property on the client side.
member.param: Name of the property to update. This is a property set in when assigning values to the dynamic "config" object.

remarks.para: Wisej only sends to the client the difference between the previous configuration values and the updated values. However, when a configuration field is an object reference and it's not cloned, Wisej cannot detect the difference.
In other cases, always when the field is an object, it's not enough to send the differences and we need to send the all the values in the object.
Calling Update("propertyName") erases the property from the cached configuration map and forces the new value to be sent to the client.

member.param: Name of the property to update.
Value to assign to the property .

member.name: T:Wisej.Core.HttpHandlerAsyncResult
member.summary:
Handles the asynchronous result from the asynchronous http request handler.
This specialized implementation allows the thread processing the request to signal to the awaiting thread that the request is completed while it may keep running in a modal loop.

member.name: T:Wisej.Core.IFileSystemProvider
member.summary:
Abstracts access to the file system.
Implementations of this interface are used by the file dialogs and other components that need to interact with the file system.
Wisej provides the built-in default implementation for the standard disk-based file system and a number of alternative implementations in the Wisej extensions, such as: Amazon S3, Google Drive, and Microsoft OneDrive.

summary.para: Wisej.Core defines all the core functionality and interfaces in Wisej. Here you will find classes to handle theme definitions, dynamic objects, JSON serialization, and all the core interfaces used by Wisej components and controls.
summary.note: Using the classes in Wisej.Core presumes advances knowledge of Wisej architecture, JavaScript concepts, and browser technology.

member.summary:
Returns the resolved with the proper RGB values. If the color specified in

member.name: M:Wisej.Core.ClientTheme.IsThemeColor(System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Returns true if the is a theme color.

remarks.para: Since the theme may also define , using on a system color returns false, but the rendering on the browser will use the color in the theme, if defined.

member.param: Color to check.
member.returns: True if is a theme color.

member.name: M:Wisej.Core.ClientTheme.IsThemeFont(System.Drawing.Font)
member.summary: Returns true if the is a theme font.
member.remarks: Theme fonts (font's with the starting with "@") are always rendered using the definition in the theme for their size and style. However, an application may use a theme font and change the size and style. In this case, the is the theme name without the "@". If the name of the font (which could be a system name like "Arial") matches a theme font, Wisej will use the theme font but it uses the size and style set by the application.
member.param: Font to check.
member.returns: True if is a theme font.

member.name: M:Wisej.Core.ClientTheme.TranslateFont(System.Drawing.Font)
member.summary: Returns the resolved from the theme font. If the font is a theme font, the value is resolved from current theme.
member.param: The to resolve to a usable instance.
member.returns: A instance that can be used directly.

member.name: T:Wisej.Core.ClientThemeReader
member.summary:
This class reads the theme settings on the server side and returns usable metrics.
It is mostly used by the designer to calculate the non-client areas and by the renderer to determine whether a color or font has to be rendered or not so that the client control reverts to the themed value.

member.name: T:Wisej.Core.DynamicObject
member.summary:
Custom fast implementation of a dynamic object that can handle the JSON serialization and deserialization.
This class implements IDynamicMetaObjectProvider allowing the DLR to compile the dynamic member access on the fly. We could have derived from System.Dynamic.Dynamic but the implementation in the .NET framework uses exceptions to manage custom properties.

member.name: T:Wisej.Core.HttpHandler
member.summary:
IIS Wisej Handler.
All Wisej requests (*.wx) are handled by this class.
- Resource requests (images, scripts, ...) go to ResourceManager - Application and Data requests go to ResponseManager
If the requests comes in as a WebSocket request, the handler manages it and sits in a WebSocket loop dispatching incoming messages to ResponseManager.

member.name: P:Wisej.Core.HttpHandler.IsReusable
member.summary: IHttpAsyncHandler.IsReusable implementation.

member.summary: IHttpAsyncHandler.BeginProcessRequest implementation.

member.summary: IHttpAsyncHandler.EndProcessRequest implementation.

member.summary: Process the incoming request http request.

member.name: M:Wisej.Core.HttpHandler.GetRequestName(System.Web.HttpRequest)
member.summary:
Extracts the request name from the request path.
Could be:
wisej.wx wisej.wx/init /Folder/wisej.wx /Folder/wisej.wx/init ~/Folder/wisej.wx ~/Folder/wisej.wx/init
In all cases the request name is "wisej.wx".

member.name: M:Wisej.Core.HttpHandler.ProcessWebSocketRequest(System.Web.WebSockets.AspNetWebSocketContext)
member.summary: Starts the WebSocket loop in response to a WebSocket upgrade request.
member.param: An instance of that represents the WebSocket connection.

member.name: M:Wisej.Core.HttpHandler.GetAcceptedEncodig(System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection)
member.summary: Returns the encoding type specified in the "accept-encoding" request header that matches the PreferredEncoding set it the configuration.

member.name: T:Wisej.Core.HttpModule
member.summary:
IIS Wisej Module.
This class hooks the BeginRequest event in order to manage smart URLs. It's not needed for the correct functioning of Wisej. It's only needed if the application wants to handle smart urls:
http://mysite.com/appname instead of http://mysite.com/appname.html
The module finds appname.json (the Wisej configuration file) in the /appname folder, reads it and finds the url property and redirects the web server to the url specified in the configuration file.
Otherwise the request must match an html file and it must be in the same folder as the Wisej configuration file.

member.name: M:Wisej.Core.HttpModule.Dispose
member.summary: Not used.

member.summary: Returns the image resource stored in the specified property of the referenced component.

member.summary: Returns the file requested in the "x" request package as a downloadable stream.

member.name: M:Wisej.Core.ResourceManager.ReturnFileResource
member.summary:
Loads an embedded resource from any assembly or from the file system. Files in the file system can override embedded resources. The root is the web application root folder.
The resource is specified as:
resource.wx/{Path} resource.wx/{Assembly}/{Name}
i.e. /resource.wx/image.jpg /resource.wx/images/image.jpg /resource.wx/MyApp/image.jpg /resource.wx/MyApp/MyApp.Resources.image.jpg

member.name: M:Wisej.Core.ResourceManager.GetRequestPath(System.Web.HttpRequest)
member.summary:
Extracts the request path.
Could be:
resource.wx/qx.js resource.wx/Wisej.Web/qx.js /Folder/resource.wx/qx.js /Folder/resource.wx/Wisej.Web/qx.js ~/Folder/resource.wx/qx.js ~/Folder/resource.wx/Wisej.Web/qx.js
In all cases the path to return is "resource.wx/qx.js" or "resource.wx/Wisej.Web/qx.js". Which is basically whatever comes after "resource.wx" including "resource.wx" excluding anything before "resource.wx".

member.name: M:Wisej.Core.ResourceManager.IsAllowedResource(System.String)
member.summary: Checks if the file extension is allowed for download.

member.name: M:Wisej.Core.ResourceManager.GetFileResourcePath(System.String)
member.summary:
Returns the full path to the specified resource.
If the resource is a local project file, it returns the project-root path.
If the resource is an embedded file, it extracts the embedded file to the project's temporary folder and returns the full temp path. For embedded resources it checks whether the date of the assembly is newer than the date of the temp file.

member.summary: Converts the object to a serialized base64 format.

member.summary: Converts the base64 string to the original object.

member.name: M:Wisej.Core.SessionManager.Create(Wisej.Core.ResponseManager,System.Object)
member.summary:
Creates a new Session and saves it into the global application cache.
The cache entry is set to expire twice the number of seconds of the keep alive interval. That means that if the server doesn't hear from the client for KeepAliveInterval * 2 seconds it will remove the session and terminate the session. Cold turkey.
member.param: The instance of the ResponseManager that is restoring the session.
The message payload being processed by the ResponseManager.
member.returns: A new .

member.summary: The total number of active sessions.

WebSocket ResponseManagers are stored with the session to be reused by different threads/requests.
Http ResponseManagers are stored at the beginning of a request and cleared at the end of the request when unlocking the session.

member.name: T:Wisej.Core.WebMethodAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the method can be called from the browser using JavaScript.

remarks.para: You can add this attribute to static methods in your Wisej application Program class and to instance methods in top level containers: Page, Form, and Desktop.

If you want to register web methods on child controls, you can, but Wisej only searches top level containers automatically. To register web methods on a child control, extend the control class, override and call .

member.name: P:Wisej.Core.Configuration.KeepAliveInterval

member.name: P:Wisej.Core.Configuration.PollingInterval
member.summary: Polling interval in milliseconds. The default is zero (disabled). If this value is set, the polling starts when the application is loaded.

remarks.para: The polling interval determines the frequency of the automatic poll requests coming from the client when a WebSocket connection is not available. When the client is connected using a WebSocket channel, this value is ignored.

An application that wants to enable automatic client updates in absence of a WebSocket connection can set this value, or it can call and to start and terminate the automatic polling from the client. Both methods are ignored when the client is using a WebSocket connection.

member.name: T:Wisej.Core.WisejSerializer
member.summary:
Wisej super performant JSON serializer.
This is a high performant and low memory footprint JSON serializer/deserializer. It has been optimized to work with Wisej DynamicObject and to streamline serialization/deserialization.
It appears to be the fastest JSON serializer/deserializer using the least memory.

member.name: M:Wisej.Core.License.LicenseManager.CheckLicense(System.String,System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary:
Verifies the license as follows:
- reads the license key and loads the existing license. - if there is no license saved on the machine, activates the license key. - if the license key is different from the saved license, activates the new license key.
member.param: The known license key from web.config or entered by the user. Or null if the caller just wants to read and validate the local license.
The assembly requesting the license check.

member.name: P:Wisej.Web.BindingSource.RefreshValueOnChange
member.summary: Enables the automatic refresh of the source property after a data-bound value has been updated in the data source.
member.remarks: This option fixes a long standing "feature" of the default BindingSource where the property that is the source of a value change is not refreshed automatically after it updates the bound data source. In a scenario where the data source "transforms" the value received from a data-bound control, the source property is not updated while all other bound properties are.
